data.title: Visit Szekesfehervar, Hungary with our intercity taxi in 2024!
data.meta_description: Székesfehérvár, often considered Hungary's historical capital, is an eclectic blend of past and present, where medieval architecture stands alongside contemporary culture.
data.text:
Bory Castle

A romantic architectural masterpiece designed and built by Jeno Bory, featuring numerous towers, sculptures, and gardens.

Cathedral Basilica of St. Stephen

A historic cathedral where Hungarian kings were once crowned, boasting stunning Gothic architecture.

King Stephen Museum

A museum offering a deep dive into Hungarian art and history, featuring a wide range of artifacts and exhibitions.

Sóstó Nature Reserve

A beautiful park and lake offering opportunities for relaxation and nature walks, just a short drive from the city.

Orbán-hegyi Pincesor

A wine cellar street where visitors can taste local wines and explore traditional Hungarian winemaking.

Doll Museum

A unique museum showcasing a variety of dolls from around the world, a fun experience for children and adults alike.

Virágóra Flower Clock

A decorative and functioning flower clock in the city center, symbolizing the city's beauty and timelessness.

Hetedhét Toy Museum

An interactive museum where visitors can discover the history of toys and even play with some.

Zichy Palace

Once a grand residence, now a gallery featuring rotating exhibitions from Hungarian artists.

Sóstó Zoo

Located near the nature reserve, this zoo provides an educational experience with a variety of animal species.
